results.title: Jingdezhen: China's porcelain capital
results.creator_credit: China Film Corporation and Ying Xiaoying
results.brief_description: Shows the different types of famous Jingdezhen porcelain, the history of porcelain-making in the area and some exquisite examples of both modern and traditional Chinese porcelain.

results.title: Jindivik: the hunted one
results.creator_credit: Supreme Film Studios, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Bewick Hack
results.brief_description: The Jindivik is the remote-control target aircraft designed and built at the Government Aircraft Factory in Melbourne. The design has been upgraded during its 20 years of existence, and the latest version can be used to test guided missiles in a variety of target situations. Cinematogrpahy by Russell Boyd.

results.title: Jindabyne (A)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Jarmar, April Films and Ray Lawrence
results.brief_description: Based on the Raymond Carver short story “So much water so close to home”, this is a compelling drama about a marriage drawn asunder by a young girl’s murder. Stewart Kane, played by Irish actor Gabrielle Byrne, goes fishing with friends to a remote spot; when he and his friends find a young girl’s mutilated body they continue with their trip, reporting the crime upon their return. Such callousness makes Claire (Laura Linney) question her marriage and her husband’s humanity and she is drawn into a web of intrigue and ethical dilemmas. Expanding upon Carver’s original text, Lawrence examines Aboriginal rites and ceremonies and places, central to the narrative, the uncomfortable relationship between the black and white communities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Jarmar, April Films and Ray Lawrence

results.title: Jin-Roh: wolves in human armour [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bandai Visual Company, Tsutomu Sughita, Hidekazu Terakawa and Hiroyuki Okikura
results.brief_description: An addition to the anime genre by the makers of “Ghost in the shell”, “Jin-Roh” is based in Japan ten years after World War Two. The cities are racked with fighting between terrorist groups and the police and the despised counter-terrorist unit. The film focuses on one of the counter-terrorists, Fuse, who fails to kill a young female suicide bomber when he has the chance. Fuse’s confidence is shaken after the event, however he tries to reintegrate himself into the unit. During this time he decides to try and find out about who the bomber was. In doing so he meets with the sister’s bomber who seems to value Fuse’s friendship. Behind this, the tension of the police and counter-terrorism unit comes to a head, with Fuse and the girl caught in the middle. The story of little red riding hood is used as a metaphor for many of the characters throughout the film. Fuse is torn apart as he sees visions of himself as one of the wolves, killing the bomber and her sister (who are depicted as little red riding hood). “Jin-Roh” keeps the audience in suspense as the story slowly unravels to reveal whether Fuse really is a wolf in human armour.

results.title: Jimmy the C
results.creator_credit: Motionpicker Studios, Jimmy the C Productions and Jimmy Picker
results.brief_description: Animated film in which a clay Jimmy Carter (using the voice of Ray Charles) evokes the simpler days prior to his Presidency by singing “Georgia on my mind”, flanked by an American flag and backed by a trio of top-hatted peanuts.

results.title: Jimmy Stewart
results.creator_credit: Del Jack, Cress Darwin and Millenial Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
This is the story of the life and career of James Stewart. Born on May 20, 1908 in Indiana, Pennsylvania, Jimmy Stewart embodied America’s idea of itself in a career spanning more than 75 often extraordinary films. Nominated for five Academy awards during his lifetime, winning Best Actor for “The Philadelphia Story” (1940), Stewart came to acting after graduating from Princeton University in 1932 with a degree in architecture. He died on July 2, 1997.

results.title: Jimmy Neutron: boy genius
results.creator_credit: Albie Hecht, Steve Oedekerk, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon Movies, O Entertainment and John A. Davis
results.brief_description: Computer animated sci-fi story about boy genius Jimmy Neutron who unwittingly causes havoc when a satellite launched by him is picked up by an alien species known as Yokians. These strange green aliens invade Jimmy’s hometown Retroville in the dark of night and abduct all the parents in the town leaving it up to Jimmy, along with his robotic dog, Goddard, his best friend Carl Wheezer and his arch rival Cindy Vortex to take to the skies in a rescue bid to save the parents from becoming human sacrifices. Features the voices of Debi Derryberry, Megan Cavanagh, Mark Decarlo, Martin Short and Patrick Stewart.

results.title: Jiminy Cricket's fabulous fables, fairy tales & other wonderful stories
results.creator_credit: Julie Jenkins, Kevin Riem, Walt Disney Productions and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Disney favourite Jiminy Cricket leads the viewer through the history of story telling, starting from Aesop’s fables and continuing through to Hans Christian Anderson and the Brothers Grimm. Stories include; THE TORTOISE AND THE HARE; THE GRASSHOPPER AND THE ANTS; OLD KING COLE; GULLIVER MICKEY; THE BRAVE LITTLE TAILOR; THE PIED PIPER OF HAMELIN; THE UGLY DUCKLING; LITTLE HIAWATHA; ELMER ELEPHANT.

results.title: Jimi Plays Monterey
results.creator_credit: Alan Douglas, Pennebaker Associates and D.A. Pennebaker
results.brief_description: In 1967 America experienced the Monterey International Pop Festival. Acclaimed artists performed for thousands of wild fans. Jimi Hendrix performed at this festival, capturing the audience with incredible music, and Hendrix is shown playing his guitar with his teeth, behind his head, and in other wild ways.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Douglas, Pennebaker Associates and D.A. Pennebaker

results.title: Jim Serafim goes to School
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, David Roberts and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A Greek child’s first day at school. Demonstrates the difficulties non-English speaking children and their parents have in their “new” country.
